alert.note: Alert for Southeast Coastal Plains; Southwest Coastal Plains and Mona Island (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 23 at 6:27AM ADT until June 23 at 7:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE SOUTHERN COASTAL PLAINS OF PUERTO RICO... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM AST THIS EVENING FOR THE SOUTHERN COASTAL PLAINS OF PUERTO RICO... The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 10 AM this morning to 6 PM AST this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 014 and 027, which includes southeast and southwest coastal plains of Puerto Rico. * WIND...East-northeast to east-southeast at around 16 to 22 mph, with stronger gusts to around 30 mph possible. * HUMIDITY...Relative humidity values from the upper 30s to upper 40s. * THUNDERSTORMS...Isolated thunderstorms are possible in southwestern Puerto Rico this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Coastal Plains; Southwest Coastal Plains and Mona Island
